identified-content.object.title: Romancing: the Life and Work of Henry Green (Book)

abstract.p: Steven Taylor letter on Charles McGrath March 25 review of Romancing: The Life and Work of Henry Green by Jeremy Treglown (S)

block.p: In his review of Jeremy Treglown's ''Romancing: The Life and Work of Henry Green'' (March 25), Charles McGrath gives as an example of Green's ''stylistic tics and eccentricities'' the absence of ''a'' and ''the,'' whenever possible, in the factory-life novel ''Living.'' This son of an English factory worker suspects there is a simple explanation: that is how working-class Midlanders talked. ''Works manager came to outside assembling shop'' is colloquially akin to my dad's habitual Saturday afternoon farewell, ''Going down pub for pint.'' The ''the'' and ''a'' are simply elided.
